alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Garden; Grant; Hooker; McPherson; Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:24PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Arthur, southwestern Cherry, Grant, southwestern Hooker, northeastern Garden, western McPherson and southern Sheridan Counties through 515 PM CDT/415 PM MDT/... At 423 PM CDT/323 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ellsworth to 11 miles south of Ashby to 8 miles west of Arthur. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Arthur, Ellsworth, Hyannis, Ashby, Duluth, Dipping Vat Meadow, Swede Lake, Cogill Lake, Green Lake, Diamond Lake, Bourquim Hill, Three Mile Lake, Pratt Lake, Krause Lake, Watson Lake, Haythorn Lake, Patterson Lake, Finnegan Lake, Lena and Sand Puddin Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 250 between mile markers 1 and 18. Highway 2 between mile markers 109 and 152. Highway 61 between mile markers 120 and 168. Highway 92 between mile markers 165 and 174. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT/800 PM MDT/ for the Panhandle of and north central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Garden; Grant; Hooker; McPherson; Sheridan; Western Cherry
